starting statistics.special qualities: aquatic, grab (medium), low-light vision, lure (sheds light as per a candle), scent

ankylosaurus.stun (ex): the ankylosaurus's tail can deliver a powerful, stunning blow. A creature struck by this attack must make a dc (10 + 1/2 hd + str modifier) fortitude save or be dazed for 1 round. If the strike is a critical hit and the target fails its save, it is instead stunned for 1d4 rounds.

aurochs.stampede (ex): a stampede occurs if three or more creatures with stampede make a trample attack while remaining adjacent to each other. While stampeding, the creatures can trample foes of their size or smaller, and the trample's save dc increases by +2.

4th-level advancement.sudden charge (ex): when making a charge attack, an axe beak makes a single bite attack. If successful, it may also attempt to trip its opponent as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If the attempt fails, the axe beak cannot be tripped in return.

starting statistics.special attacks: rage (as a barbarian, 6 rounds per day)

bear, grizzly.source: the infamous grizzly bear is a lumbering and quite impressive companion, particularly when it rises up on its hind feet to loom large. Grizzly bears strike fear into the hearts of most who encounter them.

starting statistics.special qualities: low-light vision, +2 on saves vs. Disease

bird, owl (giant).source: unlike the magical beast of the same name, this owl is a mundane but unusually large specimen of its kind, with powerful wings and deadly talons.

bird, blackwisp egret.deceptive target (ex): a blackwisp egret's glowing eyes belie its true position at night. In areas of dim light or darkness, ranged attacks against a blackwisp egret suffer a 20% miss chance.

bristle boar.spines (ex): those hit by a bristle boar's gore attack must succeed at a reflex saving throw to avoid being speared by the dangerously sharp spines around its head and neck. Failure results in 1d4 points of piercing damage.

starting statistics.attack: bite (1d4) or spit (ranged touch attack, target is sickened for 1d4 rounds, range 10 feet)

starting statistics.special attacks: rake (1d4)

cat, small.sprint (ex): once per hour, a small cat can move at 10 times its normal speed (500 feet) when it makes a charge.

ceratosaurus.blood rage*: when a ceratosaurus takes damage in combat, on its next turn it can fly into a rage as a free action. It gains +2 constitution and +2 strength, but takes a 2 penalty to its ac. The rage lasts as long as the battle or 1 minute, whichever is shorter. It cannot end its rage voluntarily.

deinotherium.sweep (ex): a deinotherium can sweep a target with its downward-curving tusks and knock the victim to the ground. As part of a charge, a deinotherium can move up to twice its base speed in a straight line and make a gore attack at any point during its movement. If this attack is successful, the target is knocked prone, and the deinotherium can deal damage with its trample attack before continuing its movement.

starting statistics.special attacks: tearing bite

dimetrodon.tearing bite (ex): a dimetrodon's jaws are filled with razor-sharp teeth of two different sizes. This gives the creature a threat range of 19-20 with its bite attack.

4th-level advancement.special attacks: poison (frequency 1 round (6); effect 1 str damage; cure 1 save, con-based dc)

dog, coyote or jackal.opportunistic bite (ex): on a successful bite attack against an opponent it's flanking or that is denied its dexterity bonus to ac, a jackal deals 1 additional point of damage.

starting statistics.special attacks: intimidating charge

giant frog.tongue (ex): a giant frog's tongue is a primary attack with reach equal to three times the frog's normal reach (15 feet for a medium giant frog). A giant frog's tongue deals no damage on a hit but can be used to grab.

giant gecko.expert climber (ex): a gecko's feet allow it to climb virtually any surface, no matter how slick or sheer. In effect, geckos are treated as constantly being under a natural version of the spell spider climb.

goblin dog.allergic reaction (ex): a goblin dog's dander is highly irritating to all creatures save those with the goblinoid subtype. A non-goblinoid creature damaged by a goblin dog's bite, who deals damage to a goblin dog with a natural weapon or unarmed attack, or who otherwise comes into contact with a goblin dog (including attempts to grapple or ride the creature) must make a dc (10 + 1/2 hit dice + con modifier) fortitude save or break out in an itching rash. A creature affected by this rash takes a -2 penalty to dexterity and charisma for 1 day (multiple allergic reactions do not stack). Remove disease or any magical healing removes the rash instantly. This is a disease effect.

yolubilis heron.still predator (ex): a yolubilis heron has the ability to stand perfectly still for hours at a time while awaiting prey, making it easy to mistake the bird's legs for slim tree trunks. A yolubilis heron can use the freeze ability while adjacent to trees or any vegetation that could conceal its upper body. While standing in water, it can use the freeze ability against submerged creatures. Other creatures with low intelligence scores or poor senses might be tricked by this ability as well.

7th-level advancement.burst of speed (su): a hypersloth can act as though under the effect of a haste spell for a number of rounds per day equal to its hit dice. These rounds can be broken up over multiple uses or used all at once.

iguanodon.thumb spikes (ex): an iguanodon's thumb spikes can inflict grievous woundsthey deal triple damage on a successful critical hit.

starting statistics.special attacks: lunge

7th-level advancement.special attacks: mandibles (1d6 secondary attack against a grabbed target), sudden strike (may take a full attack in the surprise round)

7th-level advancement.attack: bite (1d8 plus grab and poison [frequency 1 hour (6), effect 1 dex damage, cure 1 save, con-based dc])

4th-level advancement.attack: bite (1d3 plus poison [frequency 1 round (6), effect 1 str damage, cure 1 save, con-based dc])

starting statistics.special attacks: quills (as porcupine quills)
constrict (1d8)

4th-level advancement.attack: bite (1d4 plus disease [filth fever: onset 1d3 days; frequency 1/day; effect 1d3 dex damage and 1d3 con damage; cure 2 consecutive saves, con-based dc])

starting statistics.special attacks: saber-toothed bite (1d10 bite attack, only on a grapple check to deal damage)

7th-level advancement.special attacks: pounce, saber-toothed bite (2d8 bite attack, only on a grapple check to deal damage)

shark, hammerhead.description: this unusual shark is named for its blocky, rectangular head. The creature's eyes are on each side of its head.

skunk, giant.description: its unmistakable black-and-white-striped coloration gives a clear warning sign to any who've experienced this foul-smelling creature's ire.

starting statistics.special attacks: spray (ranged touch attack, 30-ft. Range, musk, usable 1/day)
starting statistics.special qualities: low-light vision, musk (fort save or sickened for 1d6 rounds, con-based dc), scent

7th-level advancement.special qualities: musk (fort save or nauseated for 1d3 rounds)

snake, reef.description: highly venomous and an excellent swimmer, the brightly colored reef snake is at home in tidal waters but can slither about on land if needed.

starting statistics.special attacks: poison (frequency 1 round [6]; effect 1 str damage; cure 1 save; con-based dc)

7th-level advancement.special attacks: poison (frequency 1 round [6]; effect 1d2 str damage; cure 2 saves; con-based dc])

snake, spitting cobra.description: this brightly colored snake can spit its venom, giving it a dangerous ranged attack.

starting statistics.special attacks: poison (frequency 1 round [6]; effect blurred vision [20% miss chance] 1 round; cure 1 save; con-based dc), spit (ranged touch attack, 10-foot range, poison, usable every 2d4 rounds)

7th-level advancement.special attacks: poison (frequency 1 round [6]; effect blindness 1 round; cure 1 save; con-based dc)

starting statistics.attack: bite (1d3 plus poison [frequency 1 round (6), effect 1 con damage, cure 1 save, con-based dc])

squid.ink cloud (ex): a squid can emit a 5-foot-radius cloud of ink once per minute as a free action while underwater. This cloud provides total concealment. The ink persists for 1 minute.

squid, giant.description: although this creature isn't nearly the size of a true giant squid, it remains large enough to do serious damage to foes with its many tentacles.

starting statistics.attack: sting (1d3 plus poison [frequency 1 round (4), effect 1d2 dex and 1 con damage, cure 1 save, con-based dc])

thylacine.powerful jaws (ex): a thylacine's muscular jaws threaten a critical hit on a natural roll of 19 or 20.

4th-level advancement.special qualities: poison skin (poison contact, frequency 1 round (4), effect 1d2 wis damage, cure 1 save, con-based dc]), swallow whole

toad, giant.poison skin (ex): a creature that strikes a giant toad with an unarmed strike or natural weapon exposes itself to the toad's poisonous skin.

7th-level advancement.special qualities: fatal gore(a walrus gore attack threatens on a 19-20)

starting statistics.special attacks: rake (1d4)
blood drain (1 con), grab

7th-level advancement.special qualities: blindsight 120 ft. , tusk (a charging narwhal can make a single gore attack with its tusk in place of its normal bite attack. If it hits, the tusk deals 2d6 points of damage, plus twice its primary attack damage modifier with a 3 critical multiplier)

4th-level advancement.special qualities: pack animal (speed is never modified by encumbrance)

starting_statistics.special_qualities: low-light vision, tremorsense 60 ft. , change foliage (su), root deep
needles (a creature grappling a hunting cactus or attacking it with a natural attack or unarmed strike takes 1d4 points of piercing damage)

4th-level_advancement.attack: gore (1d6) or 2 thorns (ranged attack, 60-foot range, 2d6 piercing damage)

4th-level_advancement.special_attacks: rage (1/day, as the barbarian class feature for 6 rounds)

starting_statistics.special_attacks: spit acid (ranged touch attack, 30-foot range, 1d6 acid damage)

4th-level_advancement.special_attacks: spit acid (ranged touch attack, 30-foot range, 1d8 acid damage)

slithering sundew.description: looking something like a two-headed serpent, this slithering plant strikes with two sticky, constricting slams.

starting_statistics.special_qualities: low-light vision; cmd cant be tripped

snapping flytrap.description: this mobile flytrap features two spiky jaws and scuttles about on a tangle of roots.

starting_statistics.special_qualities: low-light vision; cmd cant be tripped
